data.title: Apple, Google pause reviewing audio recordings from voice assistants
data.text: Apple Inc  and Alphabet Inc's  Google have globally suspended reviewing recordings from users interacting with their voice assistants, as concerns over data privacy mount.

data.title: Peter Thiel says Google's AI work in China is 'bad for America'
data.text: Last month the investor said Google has a "seemingly treasonous" relationship with China. Now, in a New York Times op-ed, he's underlining his point.

data.title: Are Apple, Google, Facebook and Amazon fair game?
data.text: CNBC's Jon Fortt sits down with antitrust experts Doug Melamed and Dina Srinivasan to discuss big tech monopolies.

data.title: Google to auction slots on Android default search ‘choice screen’ in Europe next year, rivals cry ‘pay-to-play’ foul
data.text: Starting early next year Google will present Android users in Europe with a search engine choice screen when handsets bundle its own search service by default. In a blog post announcing the latest change to flow from the European Union’s record-breaking $5B antitrust enforcement against Android last year, when the Commission found Google had imposed […]

data.title: Google to allow rivals to bid for place among default Android options
data.text: Alphabet's  Google will allow rivals to buy the chance of winning default search engine status on new Android devices in Europe, the U.S. company said on Friday in its latest proposal to ward off fresh EU antitrust penalties.

data.title: Facebook and Google's dominance in online ads is starting to show some cracks
data.text: Earnings reports from Pinterest, Snap, Amazon and Twitter show smaller players are continuing to gain market share in digital advertising.

data.title: Google to Seek Rival Search Bids to Fend Off EU Antitrust Scrutiny
data.text: Alphabet Inc.'s Google will ask rivals to bid to be listed as alternative search providers on Android smartphones to combat antitrust scrutiny. Bloomberg Opinion columnist Alex Webb has the details on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas." His opinions are his own.

data.title: Google ordered to halt human review of voice AI recordings over privacy risks
data.text: A German privacy watchdog has ordered Google to cease manual reviews of audio snippets generated by its voice AI.  This follows a leak last month of scores of audio snippets from the Google Assistant service.

data.title: Google to allow Android users in Europe choose default search engine
data.text: Google will let Android device users in Europe choose their default search engine from four options, including Google search, the U.S. company said, as it tries to quash EU antitrust concerns and stave off fresh penalties.

data.title: Google to let EU users choose default search provider on Android after record antitrust fine
data.text: Google says it will let European users select their default search engine on a new choice screen when setting up their Android device.
